page.title: 12Fruit Growing & Harvesting.
page.content: Fruit growing is a feature of the Goudhurst area. There are orchards of eating and cooking apples and pears, but cherries are no longer grown commercially here owing to the cost of labour for harvesting. Strawberries are grown on a small scale mostly for local and roadside sales, but the demands of markets in London is causing increased production. Blackcurrants & redcurramts are grown for market. The former are harvested by machine which means cutting the growing branches, but the reds are picked by hand because the fruits grow on second year wood. One farmer will grow blueberries next year- an unusual fruit for English growers. The fruit harvesting provides useful income for the families where the wife can work and take the children too. Some farmers provide creches.
